communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of every Fair Housing Act complaint made to the Department of Housing and Urban Development against respondents. I'm specifically requesting complaints made from January 2020 to the present day. I ask that they be made in electronic form. 

I also request that complaints include any responsive documents attached to the complaints.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edwin Rios

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of every Title VIII conciliation agreement made between the Department of Housing and Urban Development and respondents who were accused of being in "violation of subsection 804(a) and Section 805 of Title VIII of the Civil Rights Act of 1968." I'm specifically requesting agreements made between 2019 and the present day and ask that they be made in electronic form. As an example, I've attached an agreement made between HUD and JP Morgan Chase  https://www.hud.gov/sites/dfiles/FHEO/documents/21Chase%20Conciliation%20Agreement_Redacted_Redacted.pdf  

I also request that agreements include any responsive documents of compliance and original complaints that correspond with the agreement. In the case of the JP Morgan Chase agreement above, the agreement notes: All required certifications and documentation of compliance must be submitted to R5FHEOConciliation@hud.gov. Therefore, I’m requesting all documentation that accompanies the agreement that HUD keeps for each agreement.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edwin Rios

title: Maxine Waters housing appraisal communications
tags: department of housing and urban development

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Records Officer,



Pursuant the Freedom of Information Act, I request that a copy of the following documents be provided to me: 

I want to request any copies of all communications from February 22, 2022 and the present between Department of Housing and Urban Development and the following people and institutions: 
Congresswoman Maxine Waters
Alia Fierro, Deputy Director of Housing, Community Development and Insurance, alia.fierro@mail.house.gov
HUD secretary Marcia L. Fudge
Timothy Segerson, Appraisal Subcommittee Board Chairman Deputy Director, Office of Examination and Insurance, National Credit Union Administration
Jim Park, Appraisal Subcommittee
David S. Bunton, president, The Appraisal Foundation
Pledger M. Bishop, III, president, Appraisal Institute

On February 22, 2022, Maxine Waters sent a letter to HUD Secretary Marcia Fudge requesting "a systemic fair housing investigation into housing valuation discrimination." So this request would improve the public's understanding of the state of that inquiry. To help narrow the scope, I would like to include the following keyword search terms: 
"racism"
"discrimination"
"appraisal"
"investigation" 
"fair housing" 
"housing valuation" 
"race" 
"racial bias" 
"appraisal bias" 
"appraisal misconduct" 

Communications include any electronic (including metadata) or written form, such as correspondences, emails, documents, files, guidance, guidelines, evaluations, instructions, analyses, memoranda, agreements, notes, orders, policies, procedures, legal opinions, protocols, reports, rules, talking points, studies, or any other Record of any kind.  Any electronic communications should include any responsive documents in electronic form that are attached to emails, including .doc, .pdf, .ppt, .xls, .csv and formats therein. If links or attachments include Google Drive documents, those should be included as well.  

Please interpret the scope of this request in the broadest manner possible short of an interpretation that would lead to a conclusion that the request does not reasonably describe the records sought. If the request is considered too burdensome, I would consent to the documents being released on a rolling basis. 

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me before filling my request. I am willing to pay fees for this request up to a maximum of $100. If you estimate that the fees will exceed this limit, please inform me first. However the law allows you to impose a waiver or reduction of fees when information is sought in the public interest, as is the case for this request.

The request involves agreements with companies that violate people’s civil rights and liberties and therefore are of the public interest. Obtaining these documents would improve the public’s understanding of how HUD has investigated Waters' inquiry and what work the agency is doing to investigate discrimination in housing appraisals.  

The release of the information is for non-commercial purposes. The Guardian US is a news organization based in locations around the US, whose mission is journalism in the public interest. I am a reporter at Guardian US, and this request is for newsgathering purposes. I, or my colleagues at the Guardian US, will use the records to inform the public through our reporting. I therefore request a waiver of all fees and charges. 

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

As I am making this request as a journalist and this information is of timely value, I would appreciate that you communicate with me by email or telephone, rather than by mail, if you have questions regarding this request. I can be reached at 415-692-0856 and by email at edwin.rios@theguardian.com. 

I look forward to hearing from you in writing within 20 days. I will also call your office to follow up. Thank you for your cooperation, and thank you for your consideration of this request.

Sincerely,

Eddie

title: Need Personal Lost Records (Yuma County Superior Court)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom it May Concern:
   hereby request information  about Court Records from Yuma County in Arizona on the years of 1996 to 1999,I also request a fee waiver Im disabled and currently depend of social security assistance.
 I would appreciate to receive a paper copy sent to me to PO Box 11277,San Luis AZ 85349 or emailed. 
Thank You in advance for your assistance,I  Look forward for your response.

Sincerily:

Pio Villasenor

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Pio Villasenor
